TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit CameraMetadata extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The base class for camera controls and information.

remarks.para: The base class for camera controls and information.
This class defines the basic key/value map used for querying for camera characteristics or capture results, and for setting camera request parameters.
All instances of CameraMetadata are immutable. The list of keys with never changes, nor do the values returned by any key with #get throughout the lifetime of the object.

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

Docs.summary: Returns a list of the keys contained in this map.

remarks.para: Returns a list of the keys contained in this map.
The list returned is not modifiable, so any attempts to modify it will throw a UnsupportedOperationException.
All values retrieved by a key from this list with #get are guaranteed to be non-null. Each key is only listed once in the list. The order of the keys is undefined.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
